COVID-19 Active Response and Expenditure Support Program (RRP MLD 54189) 
TERMS OF REFERENCE FOR CONSULTANTS1 
 
1.  The transaction technical assistance (TRTA) aims at (i) establishing a monitoring system 
to ensure that the vulnerable groups obtain benefits from the government's coronavirus disease 
(COVID-19) response package, (ii) strengthening capacity of implementing agencies to deliver 
the economic and healthcare packages complying with the necessary safeguard measures, and 
(iii) drafting mid- to long-term roadmaps to improve public service delivery and monitoring 
mechanism.  
 
2.  The TRTA will be carried out by individual consultants and engagement of a consulting 
firm. For individual consultants, a total of five person-months of international and 23 PMs of 
national consulting services will be required. A firm will also be engaged for 9 PMs to handle the 
public finance management aspect of the TRTA. The consulting firm will be recruited through 
quality and cost-based selection method with technical-financial ratio of 90:10. The consultants 
will develop the (i) operational framework and strengthen the targeting delivery, (ii) monitoring 
and  evaluation  for  the  select  schemes,  and  (iii)  support  health  system  strengthening  and 
interventions relating to COVID-19 response. The assignments should be well coordinated with 
the initiatives done in the similar domain by other development partners including United Nations 
Development Programme and United Nations Children's Fund. The breakdown of consultant 
requirements is in Table 1.

A.  Individual Consultants 
 
3.  Monitoring  and  Evaluation  Specialist  (international,  5.0  person-months, 
intermittent).  The  consultant  shall  have  a  master’s  degree  in  Statistics,  Social  Science, 
Economics, Development Studies, or related field with at least 10 years of experience in M&E in 
development programs preferably in South Asia Subregional Economic Cooperation (SASEC) 
countries and a minimum 5 years of experience in social safety net programs with government or 
international organizations. The consultant will support the strengthening the M&E mechanism 
and system of collection, monitoring, reporting, and analysis of sex-disaggregated information 
and data of the Republic of Maldives closely coordinating with the other specialists, in particular 
the Gender Specialist. Detailed tasks include: 
 
1  TORs will be revised as needed at program outset to reflect other aspects which may be required in consultation with 
the relevant government agencies and other development partners involved in COVID-19 emergency response.

2 
(i)  Assess  the  existing  M&E  system  under  the  schemes  implemented  by  the 
government  for  COVID-19  response  and  identify  the  gaps  and  areas  of 
improvement of M&E.  
(ii)  Assess the existing M&E system under the COVID-19 Response Trust Fund 
Committee implemented by the government for COVID-19 response and identify 
the gaps and areas of improvement of M&E.  
(iii)  Assess the beneficiary targeting in the underlying programs in terms of economic 
status,  geographic  coverage,  age,  gender,  disability,  and  other  measures  of 
vulnerability; and suggest measures for improvement.   
(iv)  Support the government to prepare a report identifying M&E capacity gaps for 
relevant government programs containing recommendations for strengthening of 
M&E systems with data disaggregated by sex, age, and disability completed and 
endorsed by government 
(v)  Support the government to develop the capacity of collecting, monitoring, reporting, 
and analyzing sex-, and age-disaggregated data on program implementation to 
ADB.  
(vi)  Recommend  measures,  prepare  training  proposals,  and  conduct  trainings  to 
improve the performance of the M&E program.   
(vii)  Support in developing a detailed plan to strengthen the monitoring and evaluation 
mechanisms.  
(viii)  Support the government to develop a methodology to effectively identify, track, and 
reach the target beneficiaries. 
(ix)  Support the government’s monitoring and reporting to ADB, including support for 
preparing monthly progress reports in COVID-19 response for the first 3 months, 
and  quarterly  progress  thereafter  with  data  disaggregated  by  sex,  age,  and 
disability (Linked Document 2). 
(x)  Support the government in establishing a monitoring system with sex-, age-, and 
disability-disaggregated data for better tracking and monitoring of benefits accrued 
from the government's COVID-19 response to the poor, women, migrant workers, 
elderly, and differently abled 
(xi)  Assess the requirement of any tools or digital platforms that can improve the reach, 
targeting, and reporting of government programs. 
(xii)  Prepare the terms of reference of any additional experts, including information and 
communication technology experts that might be required to build the suggested 
tools and/or platforms. 
(xiii)  Supervise the service providers who will be tasked to upgrade the existing program 
M&E system and train staff (target: at least 30% female staff trained). 
 
4.  Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist (National, 5.0 person-months, intermittent). 
The  consultant  shall  have  a  master’s  degree  in  Statistics,  Social  Science,  Economics, 
Development Studies, or related field with at least 10 years of experience in M&E in development 
programs including a minimum 5 years of experience in social safety net program M&E with 
government or international organizations. The consultant will coordinate with the international 
M&E Specialist for strengthening of the M&E systems related to the government’s COVID-19 
response  in  close  coordination  with  other  specialists  including  the  Gender  Specialist.  The 
consultant will closely liaise with the government for exchange of information, conduct of meetings, 
and reporting. Detailed tasks are the same as for the Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist 
(international).  
 
5.  Gender Specialist (national, 8.0 person-months, intermittent). The consultant shall 
have a master’s degree in Social Science, Economics, Development Studies, Gender Studies, or

3 
equivalent. The specialist shall have at least 10 years of experience in gender and gender safety 
nets projects and/or programs preferably in international development projects and/or large-scale 
government programs. The consultant will support the implementation and monitoring of relevant 
gender activities through the development of a monitoring matrix. The consultant will work in 
coordination with other consultants to ensure all activities related to recovery package are gender 
responsive. Specifically, the consultant will closely support M&E specialists to strengthen the 
government mechanism of collection, monitoring, reporting, and analysis of sex-disaggregated 
information and data. Detailed tasks include: 
 
(i)  Identify  poor  and  vulnerable  population  by  gender  and  study  the  nature  of 
beneficiaries. 
(ii)  Develop  an  internal  monitoring  matrix  to  ensure  timely  and  effective 
implementation, monitoring, and reporting of gender equality results attributable to 
the targets supported by the CARES Program. 
(iii)  Support the government to develop capacity of implementing agencies in collecting, 
monitoring, reporting, and analyzing sex-, and age-disaggregated data. 
(iv)  Implement, monitor, and report against all gender-related activities and indicators 
as provided in the Linked Document 2. 
(v)  Support the performance assessment of existing safety net programs implemented 
by different government agencies to identify gaps related to gender and include 
gender responsive features in the road map. 
(vi)  Develop gender responsive manuals and reports for the schemes under  the 
COVID-19 Active Response and Expenditure Support (CARES) program with sex- 
and age-disaggregated data. 
(vii)  Conduct training for the relevant staffs on gender mainstreaming in social safety 
programs (Target: female staff comprise at least 30% of the trainees) 
(viii)  Assess the need for ADB support on issues such as gender-based violence, and 
unpaid care and domestic work to ensure relevance and avoid duplication. 
 
6.  Environment Specialist (national, 7.0 person-months, intermittent). The consultant 
shall have a minimum of Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Engineering, Environmental Health 
and safety and related subjects. The consultant shall have at least 8 years of working experience 
in implementing and monitoring environment management plan (EMP), and health, and safety 
requirements for infrastructure construction projects. The consultant will support the Ministry of 
Finance  (MOF)  as  executing  agency  and  Ministry  of  Economic  Development  (MED)  as 
implementing agency in the implementation of environment safeguard requirements under the 
Maldives CARES Program and ensure compliance with ADB Safeguard Policy Statement (SPS), 
program  safeguards  assessment  matrix,  and  environmental  assessment  and  management 
reports approved by the Maldives Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). The consultant will be 
engaged  for  5  months  with  intermittent  inputs  during  program  implementation  period.  The 
consultant will deliver quarterly environmental monitoring reports during program implementation 
(to be attached to program quarterly progress reports). Detailed tasks include: 
 
(i)  Review  the  program  safeguards  assessment  matrix  and  environmental 
assessment and management reports approved by the EPA under the program; 
and 
(ii)  Support the implementing agency to:  
(a)  Ensure compliance with the program safeguards assessment matrix and 
environmental assessment and management reports approved by the EPA 
under  the  program.  Build  capacity  of  government  in  finalizing 
environmental assessments and environmental management plans;

4 
(b)  Create  appropriate  systems  within  the  program  to  ensure  that  the 
abovementioned environment safeguards requirements are implemented 
and monitored; 
(c)  Conduct  appropriate  capacity  building  and  training  on  environment 
safeguards for program elements with safeguards risks; 
(d)  Conduct  onsite  monitoring  of  environment  safeguards  implementation 
including  COVID-19  related  occupational  health  and  safety  (OHS) 
requirements for program elements with safeguards risks;  
(e)  Conduct public consultations with communities living near program activity 
sites  with  safeguards  risks  to  minimize  negative  impacts  for  those 
communities. Ensure women participation in the consultations;  
(f)  Where possible, also conduct consultation with program beneficiaries to 
seek feedback and recommend measures for improvement of program 
impacts to the implementing agency; 
(g)  Disclose  environment  safeguards-related  information  on  the  program 
through  appropriate  channels  to  relevant  local  communities  and 
stakeholders; 
(h)  Establish a grievance redress mechanism under the program for program 
elements with safeguards risks and facilitate redressing of grievances if 
any are submitted; and 
(i)  Prepare quarterly environmental monitoring reports (to be attached to 
quarterly progress report on the entire program) documenting environment 
safeguards compliance of the program with ADB SPS, program safeguards 
assessment matrix, and EPA-approved environmental assessment, and 
management plans.  
   
7.  Environment  Specialist  (External  Monitor)  (national,  3.0  person-months, 
intermittent). The consultant shall have a minimum of Bachelor’s degree in Environmental 
Engineering, Environmental Health and safety and related subjects. The consultant shall have at 
least 8 years of working experience in implementing and monitoring EMP and health and safety 
requirements for infrastructure construction projects. The consultant will conduct third party 
monitoring of implementation of environment safeguard requirements under the Maldives CARES 
Program and check compliance with ADB SPS, program safeguards assessment matrix, and 
environmental assessment, and management documents approved by the Maldives EPA under 
the program. The consultant will be engaged for 3 months with intermittent inputs during program 
implementation and up to 3 months after program implementation period. The consultant will 
deliver (i) quarterly environmental monitoring reports during program implementation phase, and 
(ii) final environmental monitoring report immediately after program implementation to report on 
residual and operation stage impacts and recommended mitigation measures. Detailed tasks 
include: 
 
(i)  Review  ADB-approved  safeguards  assessment  matrix  and  environmental 
assessment and management reports approved by EPA. 
(ii)  Check if environment safeguards requirements including COVID-19 related OHS 
requirements have been adequately included in the bid documents for relevant 
contractors under the program. 
(iii)  Check if MOF (executing agency) and MED (implementing agency) have adequate 
systems that are functional under the program to fill in the gaps between ADB SPS 
requirements  for  environment  category  B  projects  and  the  government’s 
environmental regulations as identified in the safeguards assessment matrix.

5 
(iv)  Conduct visits once every quarter to program activity locations with safeguards 
risks  to  conduct  third  party  monitoring  on  implementation  of  environment 
safeguards.  
(v)  Monitor and/or assess impacts of the program activities during site visits on (a) air 
quality, (b) water quality, (c) soil quality, (d) noise, (v) marine biodiversity, and (e) 
occupational health and safety particularly on COVID-19 OHS requirements. 
(vi)  Carry out public consultations with local communities during site visits near the 
program  activity  sites  to  check  for  impacts  of  the  program,  if  any,  on  the 
communities.  
(vii)  Check adequacy of the grievance redress mechanism under the program. 
(viii)  Check information disclosure practices being followed under the program. 
(ix)  Based on the review of program progress reports and site visits, prepare quarterly 
environmental monitoring reports on the program for submission to MOF and 
further submission to ADB.  
(x)  Conduct site visits to program activity locations immediately after the program 
implementation period with safeguards risks and assess the sites for any residual 
or operational environmental impacts and make recommendations for mitigation 
measures  to  address  them,  if  any.  This  includes  consultation  with  program 
beneficiaries to seek feedback on the impacts of the program on them and 
suggestions for improvement, if any. 
(xi)  Incorporate comments and feedback on the reports from MOF; Ministry of Gender, 
Family, and Social Services; and ADB and other relevant organizations if required. 
 
B.  Consulting Firm (Public Finance Management) 
 
8.  Public  Finance  Management  Specialist  (international,  4.0  person-months, 
intermittent). The consultant shall have a master’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, 
Banking, Accounting, Economics, Development Studies, or equivalent. The consultant shall have 
at least 12 years of experience including, preferably, 10 years of experience in public finance 
management  (PFM)  preferably  through  working  with  the  government  or  international 
organizations. The consultant will be responsible to support the government to identify space for 
structural reform and draft mid- to long-term roadmaps to improve public service delivery and 
monitoring mechanism coordinating with the Finance Expert. Detail tasks include:  
 
(i)  Assess the constraints in the PFM systems across multiple implementing agencies 
affecting efficient delivery of services to the beneficiaries.  
(ii)  Assess the support being considered by other development partners for designing 
complementary interventions.  
(iii)  Prepare mid- to long-term road map for economic recovery, and improved public 
service delivery and monitoring mechanism.  
(iv)  Identify ADB's future support to enhance public sector management.  
 
9.  Public Finance Management Specialist (national, 5.0 person-months, intermittent). 
The consultant shall have a master’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Banking, 
Accounting, Economics, Development Studies, or related field with at least 10 years of experience 
through working with the government or central bank or private commercial banks or international 
organizations or bilateral development organizations or development projects. The consultant will 
coordinate with the international PFM Specialist to develop mid- to long-term roadmaps to 
improve public service delivery and monitoring mechanism. Detailed tasks include:

6 
(i)  Liaise with the government for exchange of information, conduct of meetings, and 
reporting. 
(ii)  Assess the constraints in the PFM systems across multiple implementing agencies 
affecting efficient delivery of services to the beneficiaries.  
(iii)  Assess the support being considered by other development partners for designing 
complementary interventions. 
(iv)  Prepare mid- to long-term road map for economic recovery, and improved public 
service delivery and monitoring mechanism.  
(v)  Present the reform proposal to the executing agency and ADB and agreements 
reached with the concerned government authorities  
(vi)  Identify ADB's future support to enhance public sector management.
